critical_sections.name: System Principles (Global Rules)
critical_sections.description: Global principles that apply to all components and specs
rules: All AI access must go through the LLM Gateway
All credit usage must be auditable and attributable
All generated artifacts must be reproducible from specs
Failures must be observable and diagnosable
No component may bypass registry governance
critical_sections.notes: These principles are non-negotiable and apply to all components

critical_sections.name: Cross-Cutting Requirements
critical_sections.description: Cross-cutting requirements for security, observability, and compliance
rules: No secrets embedded in specs or generated code
Metrics for cost, latency, and failure modes
No training on customer data by default
critical_sections.notes: These requirements are policy-level and apply across all specs

critical_sections.name: Cross-Spec Rules (Non-Negotiable)
rules: Child specs must not redefine concepts owned by SPEC-001
No API, schema, or UI detail may appear in this document
Cross-cutting rules are inherited, not overridden
critical_sections.notes: These rules prevent conflicts and ensure consistency across specs

critical_sections.name: What This Spec Is / Is Not
critical_sections.description: Clear boundaries of what SPEC-001 covers
out_of_scope: A UI or workflow implementation guide
critical_sections.notes: These boundaries prevent scope creep and maintain spec clarity
